questions.question_text: When cloning a schema, which Snowflake object will not be included in the clone?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
only named internal stage cannot be cloned

Selected Answer: B
When cloning a database or schema:

External named stages that were present in the source when the cloning operation started are cloned.

Tables are cloned, which means the internal stage associated with each table is also cloned. Any data files that were present in a table stage in the source database or schema are not copied to the clone (i.e. the cloned table stages are empty).

Internal named stages are not cloned.
reference : snowflake documentation

Selected Answer: A
Named Internal Stages and External Tables, cannot be cloned. But, External Stages and Pipes for EXTERNAL STAGES, CAN BE CLONED.

comments.content: Sorry. I selected wrongly: right answer is B.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/sql/create-clone#:~:text=statement%20is%20executed.-,Not%20cloned,Internal%20(Snowflake)%20stages,-Pipes

comments.content: My bad I wanted to type B

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Named internal stage will not be replicated/cloned to the new schema. External Stage can be cloned

Selected Answer: D
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/sql/alter-database.
"ALTER DATABASE [ IF EXISTS ] <name> RENAME TO <new_db_name>"

"ALTER DATABASE [ IF EXISTS ] <name> SWAP WITH <target_db_name>"

The question does not mention anything about the source database and shared (target) database. If shared database is "d1.r1" and there is about changing its name, only, it seems that the answer is D (like in the first syntax from above).

questions.question_text: Which command will change the name of shared database role r1 to r4?

choices.B: ALTER ROLE d1.r1 RENAME TO d2.r4;
choices.C: ALTER DATABASE ROLE d1.r1 RENAME TO d2.r4;
choices.D: ALTER DATABASE ROLE d1.r1 RENAME TO d1.r4;
choices.A: ALTER ROLE d1.r1 RENAME TO d1.r4;

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Remote Disk I/O = TIME SPENT reading and writing data from and to remote storage, when data are being accessed, does not fit into either Virtual Warehouse memory or the Local Disk. But reading and writing does not look like being blocked by remote disk access. Difficult to reply. I am selecting an answer, just for being able to post.

choices.D: The level of network activity between the Cloud Services layer and the virtual warehouse.
choices.C: Time when the query processing was blocked by remote disk access.
choices.A: Time spent reading from the result cache.
choices.B: Time spent reading from the virtual warehouse cache.

questions.question_text: What does the Remote Disk I/O statistic in the Query Profile indicate?
Which role has the privileges to describe a share?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/sql/desc-share
Only the ACCOUNTADMIN role has the privileges to describe a share. Executing this command with any role other than ACCOUNTADMIN returns an error.

To post-process the output of this command, you can use the RESULT_SCAN function, which treats the output as a table that can be queried.
The ANSWER is D

Selected Answer: C
Jiten372 is right
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/object-clone
When the COPY GRANTS parameter is specified in a CREATE TABLE statement, the create operation copies all privileges, except OWNERSHIP, from the source table to the new table. The same behavior is true for other CREATE commands that support the COPY GRANTS clause.

Selected Answer: B
I think B is correct unless OWNERSHIP is not an "explicit" privilege https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/sql/create-clone#:~:text=If%20the%20COPY%20GRANTS%20parameter%20is%20used%2C%20then%20the%20new%20object%20inherits%20any%20explicit%20access%20privileges%20granted%20on%20the%20original%20table

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

choices.B: The clone will inherit all privileges, including OWNERSHIP, from the source object.
choices.C: The clone will inherit all privileges except OWNERSHIP from the source object.
choices.A: The clone will only inherit SELECT privileges from the source object.
choices.D: The clone will not inherit any privileges from the source object.
